moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Nc3 e6 5: i would continue with development if i was playing white with the simple 7.0-0 not 7.c5 as played next by white.
moves.7. c5 Bc7: I want to keep my clergy's ( bishops ) eye on The h2 square.
moves.8. Bd2:
I would of played more positional and tried for the center control of exchanges with the following,
8.e4-dxe4 9.Nxe4 only best move 9...Nxe4 10.Bxe4-h6 11.0-0 0-0 12.Qc2-Nf6
moves.8... e5: If my opponent is not going to fight for the center then i will !!! nasty captain.
moves.9. e4: Rather white should of played 9.Nxe5 essential
moves.9... dxe4: Now the trouble starts for white.
moves.10... Nxe4: I was considering the following clear out, but felt it left me no advantage and would give white a simplified position, 10...exd4 11.Qc2-Ne5 12.Nxe5-Bxe5 13.Nxf6-Bxf6 14.0-0 h6 15.Rae1-Be6. remember these thoughts come from my mind at the time of play and not in post Motam of the game.
moves.11. Bxe4 Nf6: Perhaps 11...exd4 would of been better here for me but i wanted to get my knight into the action and head for the king but with reflection i think 11...exd4 more positional.
moves.12. Bd3: 12.Bg5 pinning the knight would of been the move here.
moves.13. Bxe4: Perhaps to hang on longer 13.Qe2 instead of move played.
moves.13... Nxe4 14. Qe2: To late here now should of played this move earlier
moves.14... Bf5: I like this move by me straight to the point no fuss.
moves.15. O-O O-O: Never forgetting the rule never leave your king in the center or do so at your peril
moves.16. Nh4: A unfortunate blunder here by white a take back move feature would be good.
moves.16... Qxh4: A gift given then i must oblige never know when you may get another.
moves.17... Bxh3: time for a tactical shot here breaking the kings defences.
moves.18. Qf3 Bh2+: A doubble whammy tactical shot,if the king takes with 19.kxh2 then 19...Bg4 drops whites queen.
moves.19. Kh1: allows white to hold on longer,
moves.19... Be6: Better than say retreating d7 or c8 the move played allows for the bishop to give a sermon to white when it later lands on c4 with a devastating blow.
moves.20. Rfe1: allows sudden death well mate in a few.
